pros: I enjoyed my time at Lowell General, I was initially hired to work on the Neuro Step Down (PCU) but later changed to the Cardiac Step Down (Dahod 4). The hospital faces the same staffing challenges as other hospitals in the area however we never were mandated, or asked to take an unsafe assignment. The staff that do work at FTE are excellent and overall the floors tend to have a low turnover rate.
cons: PCU is in need of some serious upgrading in terms of the patient rooms, pay could be better although they did just give a large raise based on years worked. Don't know if this translates to a higher rate for incoming staff.

review_title: Hey Norm, I thought this was a "partnership, not an acquisition." That is what you quoted to the Lowell Sun, is it not?
pros:
The benefits are great. Blue Cross Blue Shield, Delta Dental, VSP for eye insurance. Very cheap rates considering the extremely high number of employees. If you don't smoke, and can prove that you're 90 days nicotine free by taking a blood test, your health insurance is drastically cheaper.

The Lowell community & surrounding communities benefits from keeping two campuses with a wide range of medical services to offer, one on each side of the city.
cons: Limited growth opportunities after merger, especially in non-clinical areas as someone else said (consolidation of services, MANY layoffs). We lost a lot of wonderful, talented people from the Saints campus due to layoffs - while they kept their LGH staff. Now, people are just sliding out left and right due to arrogant LGH management. It has become a truly miserable environment at all campuses, and I think I speak for many when I say this. I haven't even heard good patient care reviews since the merger. Other than keeping Saints' building existing, this was a horrible idea.

pros: Nice management friendly employees growth
cons: Staff sometimes not supported enough

pros: Local, Compassionate, Dedicated to Community
cons: Reduction in Force due to COVID despite 13 yr career there.

pros: We have some pros like close to home. Great coworkers.
cons: Cons I can’t really think of any.

pros: This position is good in that you walk enough where you would probably not have to go the gym.
cons: Management is horrible. They favor certain employees over others and it definitely shows. Certain people get away with being very disrespectful to other employees and it is tolerated depending on who you are. It appears that hiring is mostly done by pulling random people in off the street and giving them the job. If you try to transfer, good luck! It's all a trap! They get you in the position and don't appreciate you when you are a good worker but also won't allow you to transfer.

pros:
Recent merger has allowed for consolidated services and ability to capitalize on the strength of the clinical expertise to serve the city of Lowell and surrounding areas; great company culture - team spirit and colleagues who walk and talk the mission, vision, and values: "Patients first in everything we do" and goal to become one of the best community hospitals in America and a promise of Complete connected care to the community and all patients served. The hospital is growing at a fast pace. 

The work-life balance or flexibility to enable work-life balance is a big plus! The hospital is committee to employee wellness (new wellness portal/wellness incentives)
cons: Limited opportunity for growth - at least in non-clinical areas.

pros: Great teamwork, supportive, people are always willing to help, give suggestions, cover for breaks, etc.  Mangement supports your involvement in unit and hospital wide committees and recognizes your work. Salary is very competitive and LGH is committed to keeping it that way. I'm never hesitate to voice my opinions, or concerns because I know they will be listened and responded to.
cons: Right now the Legacy project construction is a hassle for employee parking but it's a small price to pay for what we already have and will have when the new towers are completed.

pros:
The health Insurance was affordable and then they raised the prices on that too. Well, the discounts to the aquarium and Museum of Science came in handy. 
Every year there was a performance based raise and while I always exceeded and did well they give 3% of your base pay. So essentially I had about a dollar raise all together in the 4 years of being there with being a faithful employee.
cons:
THE PAY IS GARBAGE. 
Management is unprofessional. 
Nursing Assistants are running around taking care of patients, trying to make them feel good, assisting with saving lives for the equivalent pay of minimum wage.

pros: Lowell General has grown over the years making it the second largest community hospital in Massachusetts.  They are progressive and have been ranked the most wired hospital in Mass. They have also been one of the top 10 companies to work for according to Boston Business Journal.
cons: Worries more about numbers than patient acuity. Education is good, but the educators need to be more visual and on the floors.

job_title: Medical Coding Supervisor in Towanda, PA
pros: Love my job been there 4 years. Have 20+ years as co owner of OBGYN Medical Coding and billing experience and I am moving from Nh to our log home and property in Towanda (Luther Mills) Pa
cons: Remote employment according to my direct supervisor is not an option to continue working for her or unfortunately the hospital. I am well respected have vast expertise in medical coding. Previously to this career I managed a group of nearly 80 commercial loan legal documentation operations groups for Fleet Bank in Boston Ma.

review_title: Had great experience in this field
pros: Good growth in math skills learning and improved in computer skills. Building relationship with your co workers and management team. Getting involved with customers aspects and growth.
cons: Awesome in all ways building my career and knowledge as well.very friendily environment and challenging skills everyday day. Depend on your company growth and benefits they provide to you so far. Great to face more coiming and enjoy the growth of the company and new crew as well.

job_title: STaff Registered Nurse in Lowell, MA
pros: Great Magnet organization that is supportive of its staff.  Unit based councils allow staff input to incorporate changes, or improvements in departmental guidelines or policies.
cons: Too many inservices.  There should be one or two departmental clinical inservice days yearly, as opposed to one hour here and there, many of which are mandatory.  That is on top of the yearly skills day, and all of the mandatory online courses that are sent out monthly.

job_title: Information Systems Department in Lowell, MA
pros: You are offered flexible working hours. This helps when you have another job or are taking classes. Exposure to clinical systems.
cons: There is no structure for addressing IS related problems. career advancement and motivation is not encouraged.  Information is not shared across groups within th IT department. Clinical Application analyst are more respected than other IT staffs.

review_title: LGH is a wonderful organization that tailors to the surrounding communities.
pros:
The organization's motto of "patients first in everything we do" resignate throughout all departments.

People are genuinely friendly and willing to help each other.

LGH leaderships are committed to leading this organization in becoming the best hospital in the nation.
cons:
There are some disgruntle employees when it comes to parking situation.

There are some people that feel their entitled to certain special treatment.

pros: Close to home , nice facility, good group on workers, great technology, customer service focused, good computer system , brand new ICU, newer ER, spacious rooms, nice technology
cons: Older building still rooms 2 patients /room. Management takes staff for granted, pay rate is capped and considerably less the others surrounding hospital, short staffed and expect you to more work, hard to get time off.
